---{r}


library(ggplot2)

all <- read.csv(file.choose())#open CreditCard.csv 

head(all)

qplot(data=all, x=dependents, y=months) # kind of Obvious!!! 

convertto a matrix as clustering works better on a matrix 

mat <-cbind(all$dependents, all$months)

head(mat) kmeans(mat,centers=3) #All that output!!! 

 lets draw it

km=kmeans(mat,centers=3)$cluster 

-- vector of cluster belonging 

all$cl <-factor( km)

head(all) 

summary(all)

qplot(data=all,x=dependents,y=months, color=cl)

---{r}

all <- read.csv(file.choose()) #open CreditCard.csv

head(all)

install.packages("plot3D")

library("plot3D")

scatter3D(all$dependents,all$months,all$active)

mat <- cbind(all$dependents, all$months, all$active , col=NULL)

head(mat)

wss <- rep(0,15) # remember this!

wss

for (k in 1:15)

  wss[k] <- sum( kmeans(mat,centers=k, nstart=50)$withinss)

wss

plot(wss, type="b") # see the ELBOW at index = 3, so 3 clusters is best

kmeans(mat,centers=3) # divide into 3 groups lets draw it

km = kmeans(mat,centers=3)$cluster # vector of cluster belonging

all$cl <- km

scatter3D(all$dependents,all$months,all$active, colvar=all$cl)
